key_points: Nobelium, identified as from Russia, is behind recent attacks and was also responsible for the 2020 SolarWinds attacks.
The recent cyber attacks targeted about 3,000 email accounts across more than 150 organizations worldwide.
Targets predominantly include organizations in the United States and those involved in international development, humanitarian, and human rights work.
The attacks were initiated through an email marketing account of the United States Agency For International Development (USAID).
Both the Department of Homeland Security and USAID are investigating the hacking incidents.
The SolarWinds hack, discovered in December, impacted thousands of companies and government offices globally.
Microsoft President Brad Smith called the SolarWinds hack 'the largest and most sophisticated attack the world has ever seen'.
Russia's spy chief denied responsibility for the SolarWinds cyber attack but was 'flattered' by the accusations from the US and Britain.
The US and Britain have blamed Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) for the SolarWinds hack.
Microsoft indicates the attacks seem to be part of intelligence collection efforts targeted at government agencies involved in foreign policy.
